meanings.definition: To surpass in height or extent.
meanings.sent1: The tall tree overtopped all the others in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The mountain overtopped the surrounding hills.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe overtopped the other animals at the zoo, making them feel short.
meanings.sent4: His ambition overtopped his peers, propelling him to success.
meanings.sent5: The skyscraper overtopped the city skyline, reaching for the clouds.

meanings.sent1: The hot air balloon overtopped the trees as it floated higher.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness overtopped any negativity she encountered.
meanings.sent3: The kite overtopped the children's heads, soaring in the sky.
meanings.sent4: His excitement overtopped his fear, allowing him to take the leap.
meanings.sent5: The sun overtopped the horizon, bringing light to the world.

meanings.sent1: The floodwaters overtopped the riverbanks, causing a flood.
meanings.sent2: The waves overtopped the seawall during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to overtop the fence but couldn't quite make it.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm overtopped his fatigue, keeping him going.
meanings.sent5: The skyscraper overtopped all the other buildings in the city, standing out prominently.
